robot_capabilities.drone: Performs aerial site scanning, mapping, and terrain monitoring. Equipped with camera, lidar, GPS, and thermal imaging. Cannot manipulate objects but excels in overview, thermal anomalies, and search.
robot_capabilities.differential_drive_robot_with_arm: Capable of carefully brushing, collecting, and storing artifacts on flat terrain. Equipped with robotic arm, depth camera, lidar, and precision tools. Can document and label artifacts at excavation sites.
robot_capabilities.quadruped_robot_with_arm: Can traverse uneven, rocky, or fragile terrain. Equipped with robotic arm, camera, lidar, and terrain-adaptive mobility. Suitable for accessing delicate dig areas, removing light debris, and assisting human archaeologists. Suitable for tasks in slope also.

robot_morphology.drone: Payload: ~2 kg, Speed: 0–6 m/s, Weight: 9 kg, Size: 600 x 300 x 200 mm, Endurance: ~25 min, Sensor Coverage Radius: ~40 m
robot_morphology.differential_drive_robot_with_arm: Payload: ~6 kg, Speed: 0–1.5 m/s, Weight: 45 kg, Size: 850 x 500 x 500 mm, Arm Reach: ~0.7 m
robot_morphology.quadruped_robot_with_arm: Payload: ~8 kg, Speed: 0–2 m/s, Weight: 48 kg, Size: 1000 x 550 x 500 mm, Arm Reach: ~0.6 m, Terrain: rocky ground, ruins, collapsed zones

task_specific_rules: To map the area, the robot needs to go there first
task_replanning_rules: If dust obscures the camera view, halt the task and attempt lens cleaning or reposition.
If any robot gets stuck in unstable terrain, alert the team and reroute if possible.
If unexpected heat signatures are detected, reroute robots and notify for safety inspection.
